name: buzzer.play()
content:
Play a list of notes with the buzzer.

`buzzer.play()` is used to play an array of notes one after the other in one go. This can be used to craft actual songs as you can control the tempo (speed of how all of the notes will played) too.

palette_params.name: notes
palette_params.description: This can either be a simple array of notes (such as `['C4', 'D4', 'E4']`), or a two dimensional array of notes and duration (eg `[['C4'], 1], [['D4'], 1/2], [['E4'], 1/4]`). Each note will be played in sequence from first (index 0) to last (index `notes.length - 1`).

palette_params.name: tempo
palette_params.description: The tempo determines the speed at which the list of notes will be played, in beats per minute (or bpm). If a tempo is not included, notes will play at a default tempo of 120 bpm

short_description: Play a list of notes with the buzzer.
